{"step_by_step_thinking": "The study retrospectively surveyed mothers with children diagnosed with ASD during the first 4 years of life and compared them to a control group of mothers with healthy children. The mothers were asked about their prenatal consumption of folic acid using standardized questionnaires. This type of study is prone to recall bias, as the mothers' responses may be influenced by their current knowledge or opinions about the potential benefits or risks of folic acid supplementation during pregnancy.", "answer_choice": C}
